com.radirius.mercury.framework

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.framework.Core
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimationTest, BasicRendering, CameraUsage, Controllers, FrameBufferTest, GameStateTest, GraphicsTest, GUITest, Keyboard, MakingAWindow, Mouse, ParticleTest, SceneGraphTest, ShaderTest, TransformingShapes, UsingAudio, UsingTextures

    public abstract class Core
extends Object
    The Core initializes the game, runs the game loop, and cleans up.
    Author:
    wessles, Jeviny, Sri Harsha Chilakapati

      • getCurrentCore

        public static Core getCurrentCore()
        Returns The core that is currently running.

      • start

        public void start()
        Initializes and then runs the game loop.

      • end

        public void end()
        Ends the loop.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Used to initialize all resources, and for whatever you wish to do for initialization. May run on a seperate thread, while the main Thread continues to the game loop.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Called once every frame and used to handle all game logic.

      • render

        public abstract void render(Graphics g)
        Called once every frame and used to render graphics.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object for rendering.

      • cleanup

        public abstract void cleanup()
        Called when the game loop is ended.

        Updates the current game state.

        Switches to a GameState and after alerting the current GameState.
        Parameters:
        currentGameState - The GameState to switch to.

      • addDebugData

        public void addDebugData(String name,
                String value)
        Adds information to the debug data. Debug data is wiped every single update frame, so this is to be called every frame.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the debug information
        value - The value of the debug information

      • showingSplashScreens

        public boolean showingSplashScreens()
        Returns Whether the splashes screens are being shown

        Parameters:
        splash - The splash screen to add
